rigel.providers.manager module

class rigel.providers.manager.ProviderManager[source]

Bases: object

is_provider_compliant(entrypoint: Type) → bool[source]

Ensure that a given provider entrypoint class is an instance of rigel.providers.Provider.

Parameters:

entrypoint (Type) – The provider entrypoint class.

Return type:

bool

Returns:

True if the provider entrypoint class is an instance of

rigel.providers.Provider. False otherwise.

load(entrypoint: str, identifier: str, provider_raw_data: Dict[str, Any], global_data: Dict[str, ComplexDataModel | bool | float | int | str], providers_data: Dict[str, Any]) → Provider[source]

Instantiate a provider.

Parameters:

  • entrypoint (str) – The provider entrypoint class.

  • identifier (str) – The provider identifier.

  • provider_raw_data (ProviderRawData) – The unprocessed providerr configuration data.

  • global_data (RigelfileGlobalData) – The global data.

  • providers_data (Dict[str, Any]) – Dynamic data bank for providers.

Return type:

Provider

Returns:

An instance of the specified provider.

rigel.providers.provider module

class rigel.providers.provider.Provider(identifier: str, raw_data: Dict[str, Any], global_data: Dict[str, ComplexDataModel | bool | float | int | str], providers_data: Dict[str, Any])[source]

Bases: object

This class specifies the interface that all providers must comply with.

connect() → None[source]

Use this function to connect to required provider services.

disconnect() → None[source]

Use this function to gracefully diconnect from provider services.
